src/surveyor_comms.h

00022 
00023 #ifndef SURVEYOR_COMMS_H
00024 #define SURVEROR_COMMS_H
00025 
00026 #ifdef __cplusplus
00027 extern "C" {
00028 #endif
00029 
00030 #include <stdint.h>
00031 #include <limits.h>
00032 
00033 #define SRV1_IMAGE_OFF 'Z'
00034 
00035 #define SRV1_IMAGE_SMALL 'a'
00036 #define SRV1_IMAGE_MED 'b'
00037 #define SRV1_IMAGE_BIG 'c'
00038 
00039 #define SRV1_MAX_VEL_X 0.315
00040 #define SRV1_MAX_VEL_W 2.69
00041 
00042 #define SRV1_AXLE_LENGTH            0.258
00043 
00044 #define SRV1_DIAMETER 0.10
00045 
00046 typedef struct {
00047 
00048         char port[PATH_MAX]; //< Serial port communicating on.
00049         int fd; //< fd if port is open. (-1 = not valid)
00050 
00051         double vx; //< velocity in the x direction
00052         double va; //< angular velocity
00053 
00054         unsigned char need_ir; //< Do we need to read the IR?
00055         int bouncedir[4]; //< 0 = front, 1 = left, 2 = back, 3 = right
00056         
00057         unsigned char image_mode; //< Mode we want images in.
00058         unsigned char set_image_mode; //< Mode that the camera is set to.
00059         uint32_t frame_size; //< size of JPEG frame
00060         char *frame; //< Frame
00061 
00062 } srv1_comm_t;
00063         
00064 
00065 /* 
00066  * Creates a srv1 for use
00067  */
00068 srv1_comm_t *srv1_create(const char *port); 
00069 
00070 /*
00071  * Destroys.
00072  */
00073 void srv1_destroy(srv1_comm_t *x);
00074 
00075 /*
00076  * Initialized a srv1, connecting and checking the version
00077  */
00078 int srv1_init(srv1_comm_t *x);
00079 
00080 /* 
00081  * Sets the speed.  Forward velocity trumps rotational velocity.
00082  *
00083  * This function sets the speed for 2.5 seconds, so there is 
00084  * an automatic failsafe if the robot drives out of range.
00085  *
00086  * \param dx Speed in meters per second forward velocity
00087  * \param dw Speed in radians per second rotational velocity
00088  * \return 1 for success, 0 for failure.
00089  */
00090 int srv1_set_speed(srv1_comm_t *x, double dx, double dw);
00091 
00092 /* 
00093  * Attempts to read the sensors that are enabled. 
00094  * Currently only reads images and bounced IR data.
00095  * \param x robot structure.
00096  * \return 1 for success, 0 for failure.
00097  */
00098 int srv1_read_sensors(srv1_comm_t *x);
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * Resets communication buffers by reading all data waiting
00102  * and querying the version once again.
00103  *
00104  * \param x robot structure
00105  * \return 1 for success, 0 for failure.
00106  */ 
00107 int srv1_reset_comms(srv1_comm_t *x);
00108 
00109 /*
00110  * Returns an approximation of the distance an object is away with 
00111  * a IR range reading.
00112  *
00113  * \param rangereading Reading from a IR.
00114  * \return approximated distance in cm
00115  */
00116 double srv1_range_to_distance(int rangereading);
00117 
00118 #ifdef __cplusplus
00119 }
00120 #endif
00121 
00122 #endif // SURVEYOR_COMMS_H
